verses.verse: Thus the heavens<WH8064> and the earth<WH776> were completed,<WH3615> and all<WH3605> their hosts.<WH6635>

And by the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> God<WH430> completed<WH3615> His work<WH4399> which<WH834> He had done;<WH6213> and He rested<WH7673> on the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> from all<WH3605> His work<WH4399> which<WH834> He had done.<WH6213>

Then God<WH430> blessed<WH1288> the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> and sanctified<WH6942> it, because<WH3588> in it He rested<WH7673> from all<WH3605> His work<WH4399> which<WH834> God<WH430> had created<WH1254> and made.<WH6213>

This<WH428> is the account<WH8435> of the heavens<WH8064> and the earth<WH776> when they were created,<WH1254> in the day<WH3117> that the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> made<WH6213> earth<WH776> and heaven.<WH8064>

Now no<WH2962> <WH3605> shrub<WH7880> of the field<WH7704> was yet<WH2962> in the earth,<WH776> and no<WH2962> <WH3605> plant<WH6212> of the field<WH7704> had yet<WH2962> sprouted,<WH6779> for the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> had not sent<WH4305> rain<WH4305> upon the earth;<WH776> and there was no<WH369> man<WH120> to cultivate<WH5647> the ground.<WH127>
But a mist<WH108> used to rise<WH5927> from the earth<WH776> and water<WH8248> the whole<WH3605> surface<WH6440> of the ground.<WH127>

Then the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> formed<WH3335> man<WH120> of dust<WH6083> from the ground,<WH127> and breathed<WH5301> into his nostrils<WH639> the breath<WH5397> of life;<WH9132> and man<WH120> became<WH1961> a living<WH2416> being.<WH5315>

And the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> planted<WH5193> a garden<WH1588> toward<WH4480> the east,<WH6924> in Eden;<WH5731> and there<WH8033> He placed<WH7760> the man<WH120> whom<WH834> He had formed.<WH3335>

And out of the ground<WH127> the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> caused to grow<WH6779> every<WH3605> tree<WH6086> that is pleasing<WH2530> to the sight<WH4758> and good<WH2896> for food;<WH3978> the tree<WH6086> of life<WH9132> also in the midst<WH8432> of the garden,<WH1588> and the tree<WH6086> of the knowledge<WH1847> of good<WH9185> and evil.<WH9563>
Now a river<WH5104> flowed<WH3318> out of Eden<WH5731> to water<WH8248> the garden;<WH1588> and from there<WH8033> it divided<WH6504> and became<WH1961> four<WH702> rivers.<WH7218>
The name<WH8034> of the first<WH259> is Pishon;<WH6376> it flows<WH5437> around<WH5437> the whole<WH3605> land<WH776> of Havilah,<WH2341> where<WH834> <WH8033> there<WH8033> is gold.<WH2091>
And the gold<WH2091> of that land<WH776> is good;<WH2896> the bdellium<WH916> and the onyx<WH7718> stone<WH68> are there.<WH8033>
And the name<WH8034> of the second<WH8145> river<WH5104> is Gihon;<WH1521> it flows<WH5437> around<WH5437> the whole<WH3605> land<WH776> of Cush.<WH3568>
And the name<WH8034> of the third<WH7992> river<WH5104> is Tigris;<WH2313> it flows<WH1980> east<WH6926> of Assyria.<WH804> And the fourth<WH7243> river<WH5104> is the Euphrates.<WH6578>
Then the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> took<WH3947> the man<WH120> and put<WH5117> him into the garden<WH1588> of Eden<WH5731> to cultivate<WH5647> it and keep<WH8104> it.
And the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> commanded<WH6680> the man,<WH120> saying,<WH559> "From any<WH3605> tree<WH6086> of the garden<WH1588> you may eat<WH398> freely;<WH398>

but from the tree<WH6086> of the knowledge<WH1847> of good<WH9185> and evil<WH9563> you shall not eat,<WH398> for in the day<WH3117> that you eat<WH398> from it you shall surely<WH4191> die.<WH4191> "
Then the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> said,<WH559> "It is not good<WH2896> for the man<WH120> to be alone;<WH905> I will make<WH6213> him a helper<WH5828> suitable<WH5048> for him."

And out of the ground<WH127> the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> formed<WH3335> every<WH3605> beast<WH9130> of the field<WH7704> and every<WH3605> bird<WH5775> of the sky,<WH8064> and brought<WH935> [them] to the man<WH120> to see<WH7200> what<WH4100> he would call<WH7121> them; and whatever<WH3605> <WH834> the man<WH120> called<WH7121> a living<WH2416> creature,<WH5315> that was its name.<WH8034>

And the man<WH120> gave<WH7121> names<WH8034> to all<WH3605> the cattle,<WH929> and to the birds<WH5775> of the sky,<WH8064> and to every<WH3605> beast<WH9130> of the field,<WH7704> but for Adam<WH121> there was not found<WH4672> a helper<WH5828> suitable<WH5048> for him.

So the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> caused a deep<WH8639> sleep<WH8639> to fall<WH5307> upon the man,<WH120> and he slept;<WH3462> then He took<WH3947> one<WH259> of his ribs,<WH6763> and closed<WH5462> up the flesh<WH1320> at that place.<WH8478>
And the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> fashioned<WH1129> into a woman<WH802> the rib<WH6763> which<WH834> He had taken<WH3947> from the man,<WH120> and brought<WH935> her to the man.<WH120>

And the man<WH120> said,<WH559> "This<WH2088> is now<WH6471> bone<WH6106> of my bones,<WH6106> And flesh<WH1320> of my flesh;<WH1320> She shall be called<WH7121> Woman,<WH802> Because<WH3588> she was taken<WH3947> out of Man.<WH376>"
For this<WH3651> cause<WH5921> a man<WH376> shall leave<WH5800> his father and his mother,<WH1> and shall cleave<WH517> to his wife;<WH1692> and they shall become<WH802> one<WH1961> flesh.<WH259>
And the man<WH120> and his wife<WH802> were both<WH8147> naked<WH6174> and were not ashamed.<WH954>
